Installation

pip

You can install Fringes directly from Pypi with pip:

pip install fringes

From Source

To get access to the very latest features and bugfixes you have three choices:

  1. Clone pyqtgraph from GitHub with git:

    git clone https://github.com/comimag/fringes
cd fringes

    Now you can install Fringes from the source:

    pip install .

  2. Directly install from GitHub repo:

    pip install git+git://github.com/comimag/fringes.git@master

    You can change master of the above command to the branch name or the commit you prefer.

  3. You can simply place the pyqtgraph folder someplace importable, such as inside the root of another project. Fringes does not need to be “built” or compiled in any way.
